results.title: Madame Bovary [DVD]
results.creator_credit: MK2 Productions, C E D Productions, FR3 Films, Marin Karmitz and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description: A young woman from a farm near Roen in France marries her local physician. A glimpse of high society living is experienced by Emma when they are invited to a ball. She cherishes this evening, remembering it as the best time of her life. The memory fades quickly however, and reality doesn’t match her high expectations of living. Growing tired of her inattentive husband and her burdensome child, she tries to push her drab life aside, looking elsewhere for love, excitement and a risque liaison. Secretly she carries out her double life, her debt increasing to keep her high living alive. She gives her all, but in return she’s not given enough. Cast includes Isabelle Huppert, Jean-Francois Balmer, Christophe Malavoy and Jean Yanne. Based on the well known novel by Gustave Flaubert.

results.title: Madame Bovary
results.brief_description: Jennifer Jones, Van Heflin and Louis Jourdan star in the masterpiece of French literature that scandalised the 19th Century. Gustave Flaubert’s Madame Bovary is a beautiful film and a candid portrait of a woman in revolt against conventional society.
results.description: Jennifer Jones, Van Heflin and Louis Jourdan star in the masterpiece of French literature that scandalised the 19th Century. Gustave Flaubert’s Madame Bovary is a beautiful film and a candid portrait of a woman in revolt against conventional society.

results.title: Madama Butterfly
results.creator_credit: National Video Corporation, Giulio Chazalettes and Brian Large
results.brief_description: For an opera which in its original form met with derision, Puccini’s “Madam Butterfly” has more than proved those critics wrong. It is now one of the standard and favourite works adored by opera-lovers everywhere. Its themes of love and heartbreak are common in almost every human experience and its plethora of beautiful melodies make it immediately attractive to audiences everywhere. The orchestra of the Arena is conducted by Maurizio Arena.

results.title: Madam Wang's
results.creator_credit: Factory Films, Daniel Woodruff and Paul Morrissey
results.brief_description: A masochistic East German is washed up on a beach, and goes about searching for Jane Fonda (then in her aerobics queen era) in order to recruit her to the cause of communism. He hooks up with a group of outsiders, selling junk at a local flea market, whilst others prostitute themselves. Failing in his quest to recruit Jane, the young man embraces the American lifestyle auditioning for Madam Wang - owner of a venue that gives punk bands a start. With this social satire, director and Warhol cohort, Paul Morrissey targets the consumerist American lifestyle, whilst finding pathos amid the characters fringe dwelling. Please note: the quality of the transfer is of average quality.

results.title: Madadayo
results.creator_credit: Daiei Motion Picture Company, DENTSU, Kurosawa Productions, Tokuma Shoten, Yasuyoshi Tokuma, Gihei Kogure and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: The final film of Akira Kurosawa was not universally praised by critics and was in fact deemed sentimental and at times even mawkish. Nevertheless the striking cinematography, wonderful setting and gently observed Japanese customs and rituals make it a film worthy of consideration. “Madadayo” is the story of the educator and literary figure Hyakken Uchida, who was a hero of Kurosawa’s. The film follows Uchida’s life from his retirement at sixty and shows that he was a committed teacher adored by his students for his humour and wisdom. In the year 1943 Uchida buys a house in Tokyo, settles down with his wife and determines to work on his novel. But their home is destroyed in an Allied raid and the couple are forced to relocate to more humble surrounds. Former loyal students visit Uchida annually, assisting him in times of need and offering unfailing support. Vignettes display the progress of these relationships, in particular through birthday parties thrown in his honour each year, where the students revel in teasing him about death - to which he always replies that he is not ready yet. A spirited and thoughtful bio-pic, brimming with cultural nuances and an appealing cast including Tatsuo Matsumura, Kyoko Kagawa, Hisashi Igawa, Joji Tokoro, Masayuki Yui, Akira Terao, Asei Kobayashi, Takeshi Kusaka.

results.title: Mad Max II (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Kennedy Miller Productions, Byron Kennedy and George Miller
results.brief_description: Mad Max helps a small community defend itself against gangs desperate for fuel. Set in a post WW3 world where gasoline is the only hard currency. Stars Mel Gibson and Bruce Spence.

results.title: Mad love: three films by Evgenii Bauer
results.brief_description: Three short silent films by Soviet director Evegnii Bauer. “Twilight of a woman’s soul” Vera, a wealthy lady of society who distributes alms to the poor is raped by a lascivious working class brute; traumatised, she kills him. Shortly after she becomes engaged to a charming and urbane Prince, who, appalled by her confession, spurns her, only to regret his impetuousness. “After death” Andrei, a young man living in seclusion, is obsessed with death. He attends a lavish garden party where he meets a beguiling actress. Andrei rejects her declaration of love, and following her suicide, laments his actions and is haunted by her ghost. “The Dying swan” A painter, obsessed with capturing death in his work, becomes enraptured with the talents of a mute ballerina whose most famed work is ‘The Dying swan’. When the dancer becomes enlivened by love, the artist determines that she will remain the essence of death. In these expressionistic works, Bauer explores the themes of obsession, death, desire, suicide, tragic love and the artistic temperament depicting a reality permeated by dreams, ghosts and visions. With musical score, Russian intertitles and English subtitles.

results.title: Mad double!
results.creator_credit: Thirtieth Cemalux and Home Entertainment Holdings
results.brief_description: Featuring the slapstick madness of two of Hollywood’s most famous comedy duos, Abbott and Costello and Laurel and Hardy, this compilation video also includes excerpts from two Abbott and Costello films and their classic comedy sketch “Who’s on first?” and two Laurel and Hardy films, “Tit for tat” and “Another fine mess”.
